Navigation
Name Test/Libraries/List/tail
Synopsis Get the tail element(s) from a list.
Function
  1. list[&T] tail(list[&T] lst)
  2. list[&T] tail(list[&T] lst, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsError
Usage import List;
Description
  1. Return a list consisting of all but the first element of lst.
  2. Return a list consisting of the last n elements of lst.
Examples All but first element: 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>tail([10,20,30]);
list[int]: [20,30]
rascal>tail([]);
exception:EmptyList()
stacktrace:|eval:///?command=tail%28%5B%5D%29%3B|(0,8,<1,0>,<1,8>)
	somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.Prelude.tail(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IList)
	somewhere in: ***screen***
Last n elements: 
rascal>tail([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60], 3);
list[int]: [40,50,60]
rascal>tail([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60], 10);
exception:IndexOutOfBounds(4)
stacktrace:|eval:///?command=tail%28%5B10%2C+20%2C+30%2C+40%2C+50%2C+60%5D%2C+10%29%3B|(0,34,<1,0>,<1,34>)
	somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.Prelude.tail(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IList,org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IInteger)
	somewhere in: ***screen***
